title: ML: k-Nearest Neighbors Manual Prediction
story: k-NN predicts by finding the k closest training points and taking majority vote. Simple but effective!
instructions: Predict class for point [3] using k=3. Training: X=[1,2,4,5], y=[0,0,1,1]. Find 3 nearest, take majority. Print prediction.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

X_train = np.array([1, 2, 4, 5])
y_train = np.array([0, 0, 1, 1])
test_point = 3
k = 3

# Calculate distances
distances = np.abs(X_train - test_point)

# Get indices of k nearest
nearest_indices = np.argsort(distances)[:k]

# Get their labels
nearest_labels = y_train[nearest_indices]

# Majority vote
prediction = np.bincount(nearest_labels).argmax()

print(prediction)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

X_train = np.array([1, 2, 4, 5])
y_train = np.array([0, 0, 1, 1])
test_point = 3
k = 3

distances = np.abs(X_train - test_point)
nearest_indices = np.argsort(distances)[:k]
nearest_labels = y_train[nearest_indices]
prediction = np.bincount(nearest_labels).argmax()

print(prediction)
